meanings.sent1: I tend to procrastinate when it comes to cleaning my room.
meanings.sent2: Don't procrastinate on submitting your homework assignments.
meanings.sent3: I always procrastinate on doing chores, and then I have to rush through them.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on making important decisions can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: She knew she had to stop procrastinating and start studying for the exam.

meanings.sent1: If you procrastinate your tasks, they might pile up.
meanings.sent2: It's not wise to procrastinate paying your bills.
meanings.sent3: I tend to procrastinate on going to the dentist, even though I know I should go.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on fixing the leaky faucet only made the problem worse.
meanings.sent5: He realized he had to stop procrastinating and start working on his project.

meanings.sent1: It's easy to procrastinate making difficult decisions.
meanings.sent2: Don't procrastinate your responsibilities at work.
meanings.sent3: I always procrastinate on replying to emails, and then I forget to respond.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on seeking medical help can worsen your condition.
meanings.sent5: She finally decided to stop procrastinating and book her flight tickets.
